qas.question: How much revenue does mining provide Namibia?
Where does Namibia rank in the exportation of uranium?
Namibia was expected to become the largest exporter of what in 2015?
What does rich alluvial diamond deposits make Namibia a source of?

context: Providing <a0_0>25%<a0_0/> of <b5_0><b7_0><b8_0>Namibia<b8_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/>'s revenue, <b4_0>mining<b4_0/> is the single most important contributor to the economy. Namibia is the fourth largest exporter of non-fuel minerals in Africa and the world's <a1_0>fourth<a1_0/> largest producer of uranium. There has been significant investment in uranium mining and Namibia is set to become the largest exporter of <a2_0>uranium<a2_0/> by <b6_0>2015<b6_0/>. Rich alluvial diamond deposits make Namibia a primary source for <a3_0>gem-quality diamonds<a3_0/>. While Namibia is known predominantly for its gem diamond and uranium deposits, a number of other minerals are extracted industrially such as lead, tungsten, gold, tin, fluorspar, manganese, marble, copper and zinc. There are offshore gas deposits in the Atlantic Ocean that are planned to be extracted in the future. According to "The Diamond Investigation", a book about the global diamond market, from 1978, De Beers, the largest diamond company, bought most of the Namibian diamonds, and would continue to do so, because "whatever government eventually comes to power they will need this revenue to survive".
